title: Stretching Guide
summary: Post-play recovery routine for flexibility and soreness relief.

sections.title: Why stretching matters
items: Helps the body transition from high intensity to rest.
Reduces muscle soreness and prevents stiffness.
Improves long-term flexibility and recovery.

sections.title: Phase 1: Gradual heart rate reduction (2-3 min)
items: Slow walking (1-2 min): around the court, keep moving.
Light jogging (1 min): optional if heart rate is still high.
Deep breathing (1 min): inhale 4 sec, exhale 6 sec.
Do not sit or lie down immediately after intense play.

sections.title: Phase 2: Static stretching - Upper body (4-5 min)
items: Neck side stretch: tilt head, gently press with hand.
Shoulder cross-body stretch: pull arm across chest.
Triceps stretch: overhead arm, gently push elbow.
Forearm flexor stretch: palm up, pull fingers back.
Forearm extensor stretch: palm down, press hand down.
Wrist circles (slow): gentle rotations.
Cat-cow stretch: alternate arching and rounding.
Child's pose: kneel and reach arms forward.
Seated torso twist: twist toward bent knee.

sections.title: Phase 3: Static stretching - Lower body (4-5 min)
items: Standing quad stretch: pull heel toward glute, knees together.
Hip flexor stretch (lunge): gently push hips forward.
Pigeon pose or figure-4 stretch: hip rotators and glutes.
Standing hamstring stretch: hinge at hips with heel down.
Seated hamstring stretch: reach toward toes.
Calf stretch (wall): heel pressed into ground.
Achilles stretch: bend back knee slightly.
Butterfly stretch: press knees toward ground.
Wide-leg forward fold: reach forward between legs.

sections.title: Phase 4: Optional recovery techniques (2-5 min)
items: Foam rolling: quads, hamstrings, calves, back.
Massage ball: target feet or shoulders.
Leg elevation: 5-10 min against a wall.
Hydration: water or electrolyte drink.
Light snack: protein and carbohydrates within 30 min.

sections.title: Quick reference checklist
items: Heart rate gradually lowered (no sudden stop).
Upper body stretched (shoulders, arms, wrists, back).
Lower body stretched (quads, hamstrings, calves, hips).
Hydration started.
Body feels relaxed, not tense.

sections.title: Common mistakes to avoid
items: Skipping stretching entirely.
Stretching cold muscles.
Bouncing during stretches.
Rushing through recovery.
Ignoring hydration.
